item.title: Bulletin updated at 12:56 HKT 28/06/2023
item.description:
At noon at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 31 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 79 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 10
Intensity of UV radiation : very high

The tropical disturbance over the northeastern part of the South China Sea is still loosely organised. Based on the latest observations, the atmospheric environment is not favorable for the disturbance to further develop and the disturbance will remain as a relatively weak system. The disturbance is expected to edge closer to the coastal areas of eastern Guangdong tomorrow (29 June) and keep a distance from Hong Kong; or gradually dissipate over the sea. The Observatory will continue to closely monitor the movement of the disturbance.

Hot weather might cause adverse health effects. The public should stay on the alert and drink more water.

Please be reminded that:
The Thunderstorm Warning has been issued. It will remain effective until 3:00 p.m. today. Isolated squally thunderstorms are expected to occur over Hong Kong.
